job_title: Faculty in University Heights, Cuyahoga, OH
pros: Not many pros remaining as the school is far behind the times.  Most of what made John Carroll a special place for students to learn and staff to work has been destroyed by the current self-serving CFO who slashed positions, suppressed wages and destroyed staff-faculty relations while lining his pockets and those in his inner-circle.
cons: Senior "leaders" lack any sort of effective communication and listening skills.  They are lead by an incompetent and chauvinistic CFO who consistently lies and "leads" by fear.   Wages for faculty and staff are extremely low compared to other comparable private universities while senior leaders continue to enjoy exorbitant annual wage increases and other perks.  Adjunct faculty (instructors) are not paid a sustainable living wage and are increasingly being used to replace properly trained faculty.  This intention is to weaken faculty's position -- all while tuition continues to increase for students who are lead to believe JCU embraces Jesuit values.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in University Heights, Cuyahoga, OH
pros: Outstanding, dedicated staff who support Jesuit values and care about students.
cons: Inept leadership who makes poor decisions and jeopardizes the future of the University

job_title: Graduate Assistant in University Heights, OH
pros: The people make this place what it is. If you are in a department that's supportive of your expertise and goals, you will thrive and feel at home.
cons:
Some changes in the past have led to phenomenal staff members leaving, as contracts had to be cut and restructuring occurred.  I empathize and appreciate the difficulty of navigating a university through fiscal changes. That said, John Carroll lost a few gems while I worked there that were enormously appreciated by their immediate colleagues, but did feel the same level of support from university decision-makers.

Lots of factors go into the kinds of decisions I've referenced! John Carroll is an amazing place to work. I am proud to have worked there. I would highly recommend this as a place of employment to those looking for a work culture that values service and work-life balance.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cleveland, OH
pros: Average benefits, recreation center access
cons: Incompetent CFO (ruined school); financial stress due to poor decision making; HLC accreditation issues loom; dysfunctional administration; underpaid staff (overpaid senior leadership); fail to pay living wages to coaches and adjunct faculty; failure to pay overtime to employees who are wrongly classified as salaried; huge discrepancies in pay between men and women in same or similar roles.

review_title: JCU: great place to get experience; however, the quality of work depends on which professor you are employed with
